Scheduler "zero" time for task phase control

briefdescription.para: Hook function for the idle task.
reads non-volatile memory and initializes the sys module

detaileddescription.para: Start up at scheduler start, called from 1ms-Task before the 1ms cyclic execution

briefdescription.para: Database-Task The task manages the data exchange with the database and must have a higher task priority than any task using the database.
cyclic 1ms-Task, preemptive with TSK_Cyclic_10ms() and TSK_Cyclic_100ms().

detaileddescription.para: The Task calls OsStartUp() in the very beginning, this is the first active Task. Then the Task is delayed by a phase as defined in eng_tskdef_cyclic_1ms.Phase (in milliseconds). After the phase delay, the cyclic execution starts, the entry time is saved in currentTime. After one cycle, the Task is set to sleep until entry time + eng_tskdef_cyclic_1ms.CycleTime (in milliseconds). The Task calls Job_1ms(), Job_2ms() and Job_5ms().

briefdescription.para: cyclic 10ms-Task, preemptive with TSK_Cyclic_1ms() and TSK_Cyclic_100ms().

detaileddescription.para: Task is delayed by a phase as defined in eng_tskdef_cyclic_10ms.Phase (in milliseconds). After the phase delay, the cyclic execution starts, the entry time is saved in currentTime. After one cycle, the Task is set to sleep until entry time + eng_tskdef_cyclic_10ms.CycleTime (in milliseconds). The task calls Job_10ms() and Job_50ms().

briefdescription.para: cyclic 100ms-Task, preemptive with TSK_Cyclic_1ms() and TSK_Cyclic_10ms().

detaileddescription.para: Task is delayed by a phase as defined in eng_tskdef_cyclic_100ms.Phase (in milliseconds). After the phase delay, the cyclic execution starts, the entry time is saved in currentTime. After one cycle, the Task is set to sleep until entry time + eng_tskdef_cyclic_100ms.CycleTime (in milliseconds). The task calls Job_100ms(), Job_500ms() and Job_1s().
Task configurations (cycle and delay time) are specified by eng_tskdef_eventhandler.
Task configurations (cycle and delay time) are specified by eng_tskdef_diagnosis.

briefdescription.para: auxiliary function to distinguish OS Task from an ISR

detaileddescription.para: checks the function context: task (thread) mode or interrupt (handler) mode

briefdescription.para: Enter Critical interface function for use in FreeRTOS-Tasks and FreeRTOS-ISR.

detaileddescription.para: checks the function context (task/thread mode or interrupt (handler) mode) and calls the corresponding enter-critical function

briefdescription.para: Exit Critical interface function for use in FreeRTOS-Tasks and FreeRTOS-ISR.

detaileddescription.para: checks the function context (task/thread mode or interrupt (handler) mode) and calls the corresponding exit-critical function

briefdescription.para: Implementation of the tasks used by the system, headers.
